citation.article-title: Sneathiella glossodoripedis sp. nov., a marine alphaproteobacterium isolated from the nudibranch Glossodoris cincta, and proposal of Sneathiellales ord. nov. and Sneathiellaceae fam. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Sneathiella glossodoripedis sp. nov.

Sneathiella glossodoripedis [glos.so.do.ri.pe′dis. N.L. n. Glossodoris name of a zoological genus; L. gen. n. pedis of the foot; N.L. gen. n. Glossodoripedis of the foot of Glossodoris (G. cincta), the source of isolation of the type strain].
Cells are slightly curved rods, 0.2–0.3×0.7–1.0 μm, motile by one polar flagellum, non-spore-forming and have poly-β-hydroxybutyrate inclusions.
Colonies on MA are colourless, circular, convex, smooth and less than 1.0 mm in diameter after incubation for 1 week at 30 °C.
Optimum growth occurs at 40 °C, while no growth occurs at 10 or 50 °C.
Cultures grow aerobically, but not anaerobically.
The ubiquinone system is Q-10 and the major cellular fatty acids are C18 : 1ω7c, C16 : 0, C17 : 1 and C14 : 0 3-OH.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 56.9 mol%.

The type strain is positive for catalase, oxidase, arginine dihydrolase, ornithine decarboxylase, tryptophan deaminase, production of acetoin, utilization of citrate and reduction of nitrate to nitrite, but negative for urease, gelatinase, production of H2S and indole, reduction of nitrite to N2 and assimilation of d-glucose, d-mannose, inositol, sorbitol, rhamnose, sucrose, melibiose, amygdalin and arabinose.

In assays with the API ZYM system, alkaline phosphatase, esterase (C4) (weak), esterase lipase (C8) (weak), leucine arylamidase, trypsin (weak), acid phosphatase, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase, α-glucosidase (weak) and N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase are detected, but lipase (C4), valine arylamidase, cystine arylamidase, α-chymotrypsin, α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, β-glucosidase, α-mannosidase and α-fucosidase are not detected.
The type strain is MKT133T (=IAM 15419T =KCTC 12842T), which was isolated from the nudibranch Glossodoris cincta off Aka island, Okinawa, Japan.
